perturbation.original_text: WHEREAS Shi Farms grows industrial hemp and wishes to sell hemp biomass ("Product"); and Gridiron wishes to purchase Product from Shi Farms; and Both Parties acknowledge that Shi Farms is the owner of the Product as defined below; and Shi Farms is willing to sell Product to Gridiron and Gridiron desires to acquire in accordance with the terms and conditions set forth below.
perturbation.changed_text: WHEREAS Shi Farms grows industrial hemp and wishes to sell hemp biomass ("Product"); and Gridiron wishes to purchase Goods from Shi Farms; and Both Parties acknowledge that Shi Farms is the owner of the Product as defined below; and Shi Farms is willing to sell Merchandise to Gridiron and Gridiron desires to acquire in accordance with the terms and conditions set forth below.
perturbation.explanation: The terms "Product," "Goods," and "Merchandise" are used interchangeably without defining whether they all refer to the same hemp biomass. This creates confusion about what exactly Shi Farms is obligated to sell and Gridiron is obligated to purchase.

perturbation.original_text: Shi Farms agrees to sell Product and Gridiron agrees to purchase 30,000 lbs. of hemp biomass ("Biomass") from Shi Farms. Biomass must contain a minimum of six percent (6%) total Cannabidiol (CBD/and or CBDA) and all Biomass must have less than three percent (3%) total TCH content.
perturbation.changed_text: Shi Farms agrees to sell Product and Gridiron agrees to purchase 30,000 lbs. of hemp biomass ("Material") from Shi Farms. Biomass must contain a minimum of six percent (6%) total Cannabidiol (CBD/and or CBDA) and all Raw Material must have less than three percent (3%) total TCH content.
perturbation.explanation: The terms "Biomass", "Material", and "Raw Material" are used interchangeably without defining them. One sentence refers to "Biomass", the next to "Material", and then the third to "Raw Material" raising questions whether the 30,000 lbs. has to be only Biomass, only Material, or only Raw Material. This is a direct contradiction, because while the main sentence says 30,000 lbs. of hemp biomass, the next sentence dictates the requirements for "Raw Material", suggesting it is not always "Biomass".

perturbation.original_text: Once the payment has been received, Shi Farms will use its best efforts to quarantine product to ensure safe keeping of the Product until delivery date as agreed by the Parties.
perturbation.changed_text: Once the payment has been received, Shi Farms will use its best efforts to quarantine the items to ensure safe keeping of the Goods until delivery date as agreed by the Parties.
perturbation.explanation: The original text refers to 'product' and 'Product,' while the changed text uses 'items' and 'Goods.' This introduces uncertainty, because the items quarantined might not be what was bargained for as 'Product', potentially affecting the quality and compliance standards specified in the agreement.
